main event: The report details an incident where a civilian claimed to have found a flying disc in Shreveport, Louisiana on 7th July 1947, which was later revealed to be a practical joke perpetrated by a man from Shreveport who manufactured the disc as a prank.
interesting points: The disc was described as having smoke and fire coming from it and was reported to have landed in the street after traveling at a high rate of speed.

Examination of the disc revealed that it was made from aluminum, thermoset, and condensers, and was equipped with a light, copper wires, and soot on its edges to create the impression of high-speed motion.
The manufacturer of the disc admitted to making it as a joke on his boss, using parts from a mousetrap light and condensers from electric trains.
The FBI agent observed the disc and reported it as 16 inches in diameter with small coils, copper wires, and an object with the label 'Made in USA' at its center.
The investigation concluded that the entire incident was a practical joke, and no further investigation was deemed necessary.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
